pullRequest.body:
Define `Derivation.coeffwise`, which applies the derivation to the a polynomial coefficient-wise.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*

Deletions:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9deed4ebc9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14702/commits/9deed4ebc900e6794b95ab837bf651a753a8acb9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Derivation.MapCoeffs`|987|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ apply_aeval_eq`
`+ apply_aeval_eq'`
`+ apply_eval_eq`
`+ mapCoeffs`
`+ mapCoeffs_C`
`+ mapCoeffs_X`
`+ mapCoeffs_apply`
`+ mapCoeffs_monomial`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
How could the typeclass parameters of `PolynomialModule.map` be relaxed? Its domain is `PolynomialModule R M`, which requires `CommRing R`. You'd have to relax all of `PolynomialModule`.
You're right. Then that's the thing to do if you really care about semirings.
I added the lemmas. I'm not sure about changing the definition - it makes `coeffwise_apply` definitional, and is a bit cleaner, but loses `R` being a semiring.
I don't think that matters much, unless you absolutely need semirings. Someone else who needs semirings may generalise `PolynomialModule` altogether.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14701~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@erdOne Did you perhaps forget to submit the review? I'm not seeing anything.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Thanks!

bors merge

Build failed:
  * Build
bors merge

:lock: Permission denied

Existing reviewers: [click here to make Command-Master a reviewer](https://mathlib-bors-ca18eefec4cb.herokuapp.com/repositories/16/add-reviewer/Command-Master)
maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10811415813/job/29990763828)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10811415813/job/29990764179)
maintainer merge

```lean
/--
The `R`-derivation from `A[X]` to `M[X]` which applies the derivative to each
of the coefficients.
-/
def coeffwise : Derivation R A[X] (PolynomialModule A M) where
  __ := (PolynomialModule.map A d.toLinearMap).comp
    PolynomialModule.equivPolynomial.symm.toLinearMap
  map_one_eq_zero' := show (Finsupp.single 0 1).mapRange (d : A → M) d.map_zero = 0 by simp
  leibniz' p q := by
    dsimp 
    induction p using Polynomial.induction_on' with
    | h_add => simp only [add_mul, map_add, add_smul, smul_add, add_add_add_comm, *]
    | h_monomial n a =>
      induction q using Polynomial.induction_on' with
      | h_add => simp only [mul_add, map_add, add_smul, smul_add, add_add_add_comm, *]
      | h_monomial m b =>
        refine Finsupp.ext fun i ↦ ?_
        dsimp [PolynomialModule.equivPolynomial, PolynomialModule.map]
        simp only [toFinsupp_mul, toFinsupp_monomial, AddMonoidAlgebra.single_mul_single]
        show d _ = _ + _
        erw [Finsupp.mapRange.linearMap_apply, Finsupp.mapRange.linearMap_apply]
        rw [Finsupp.mapRange_single, Finsupp.mapRange_single]
        erw [PolynomialModule.monomial_smul_single, PolynomialModule.monomial_smul_single]
        simp only [AddMonoidAlgebra.single_apply, apply_ite d, leibniz, map_zero, coeFn_coe,
          PolynomialModule.single_apply, ite_add_zero, add_comm m n]

@[simp]
lemma coeffwise_apply (p : A[X]) (i) :
    d.coeffwise p i = d (coeff p i) := rfl

@[simp]
lemma coeffwise_monomial (n) (x : A) :
    d.coeffwise (monomial n x) = .single A n (d x) := Finsupp.ext fun _ ↦ by
  simp [coeff_monomial, apply_ite d, PolynomialModule.single_apply]

@[simp]
lemma coeffwise_X :
    d.coeffwise (X : A[X]) = 0 := Finsupp.ext fun _ ↦ by
  simp [← monomial_one_one_eq_X]

theorem apply_eval_eq (x : A) (p : A[X]) :
    d (eval x p) = PolynomialModule.eval x (d.coeffwise p) + eval x (derivative p) • d x := by
  induction p using Polynomial.induction_on' with
  | h_add => simp_all only [eval_add, map_add, add_smul]; abel
  | h_monomial n a =>
    simp only [eval_monomial, leibniz, leibniz_pow, coeffwise_monomial,
      PolynomialModule.eval_single, derivative_monomial, ← mul_smul, nsmul_eq_smul_cast A]
    rw [add_comm]
    congr 2
    ring
```
This seems like a better approach. Note that you would need to relax the typeclass arguments on `PolynomialModule.map` to make this work.
By the way it would be nice if you can identify the missing lemmas and remove those `erw`s.
maintainer merge
I think you should create a new file for this material. One shouldn't need to know about `PolynomialModule` just to talk about the basic material here.
I moved it to `RingTheory/Derivation/Polynomial.lean`.

I don't really understand this concern. `PolynomialModule` is a basic file and the imports of that file are already imported by `Polynomial/Derivation`. Anyways splitting is still nice but I think it's confusing to have `Polynomial/Derivation` and `Derivation/Polynomial`. Can you give it a better name?
Is there anything you suggest?
Not sure. Maybe `Polynomial/Derivation/MapCoeffs` and the original file to `Polynomial/Derivation/Basic`
I'm not sure if `Polynomial/Derivation` should be a directory, is there anything else which could be placed there?
Perhaps the original file could be moved to `RingTheory/Derivation/Polynomial` and this will be `RingTheory/Derivation/MapCoeffs`?

Could we have a more standard name?

Either `mapCoeffs` or `Derivation.polynomialModule`?
Renamed to `mapCoeffs`.

Could you please rename `K` to `B`? To me, `K` suggests that it is a field.

Note that, in VSCode, if you place your cursor on `K` and hit <F2> then you can rename it once, and it will update all other occurences of `K` for you.
Would it make sense to rename `d2` to `d'`, in analogy with `M` and `M'`?

This name is ambiguous in that one could also derive the a multivariate polynomial coefficient-wise. What about something like this?
```suggestion
def polynomialCoeffs : Derivation R A[X] (PolynomialModule A M) where
```
Should I also change the file name, or is it ok?
Thinking about it a bit more, I don't love `polynomialCoeffs` - it feels weird to write `D.polynomialCoeffs p`
I would personally just call it `Derivation.Polynomial`, but I don't know 🤷
Perhaps just `Derivation.poly`? Or is that too confusing?
In absolute, it might not be confusing. But here it would be confusing to the extent that existing files about `Polynomial` have `Polynomial` in their name, not just `Poly`.
Perhaps `Polynomial.differentiateCoeffs`? Although that's still quite long

I think it's fine for the file name to not include the fact that you're differentiating the coefficients only. After all, one could later add the obvious `X ^ n ↦ n * X ^(n - 1)` differentiation to this file later
This was originally in the same file as that derivation (`Algebra/Polynomial/Derivation`), but I moved it to this file
Oh I see. I guess it can go back there
@semorrison @erdOne could we get your opinions on this?
In #14967 I also import `RingTheory.Derivation.DifferentialRing` to this file, so I think it's good to keep as a separate file
How bad do you think this name is? I'm unable to think of any alternative I like
I guess it's fine, but let's not resolve this conversation in case someone thinks of a better name
I feel like this is a bit of a blank statement. Eg you are not proving anything about the obvious derivation on polynomials which sends `X ^ n` to `n • X ^ (n - 1)`. Can you expand?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Polynomial/Derivation): coefficient-wise derivation on a polynomial

</details>

```lean
/--
The `R`-derivation from `A[X]` to `M[X]` which applies the derivative to each
of the coefficients.
-/
def coeffwise : Derivation R A[X] (PolynomialModule A M) where
  __ := (PolynomialModule.map A d.toLinearMap).comp
    PolynomialModule.equivPolynomial.symm.toLinearMap
  map_one_eq_zero' := show (Finsupp.single 0 1).mapRange (d : A → M) d.map_zero = 0 by simp
  leibniz' p q := by
    dsimp 
    induction p using Polynomial.induction_on' with
    | h_add => simp only [add_mul, map_add, add_smul, smul_add, add_add_add_comm, *]
    | h_monomial n a =>
      induction q using Polynomial.induction_on' with
      | h_add => simp only [mul_add, map_add, add_smul, smul_add, add_add_add_comm, *]
      | h_monomial m b =>
        refine Finsupp.ext fun i ↦ ?_
        dsimp [PolynomialModule.equivPolynomial, PolynomialModule.map]
        simp only [toFinsupp_mul, toFinsupp_monomial, AddMonoidAlgebra.single_mul_single]
        show d _ = _ + _
        erw [Finsupp.mapRange.linearMap_apply, Finsupp.mapRange.linearMap_apply]
        rw [Finsupp.mapRange_single, Finsupp.mapRange_single]
        erw [PolynomialModule.monomial_smul_single, PolynomialModule.monomial_smul_single]
        simp only [AddMonoidAlgebra.single_apply, apply_ite d, leibniz, map_zero, coeFn_coe,
          PolynomialModule.single_apply, ite_add_zero, add_comm m n]

@[simp]
lemma coeffwise_apply (p : A[X]) (i) :
    d.coeffwise p i = d (coeff p i) := rfl

@[simp]
lemma coeffwise_monomial (n) (x : A) :
    d.coeffwise (monomial n x) = .single A n (d x) := Finsupp.ext fun _ ↦ by
  simp [coeff_monomial, apply_ite d, PolynomialModule.single_apply]

@[simp]
lemma coeffwise_X :
    d.coeffwise (X : A[X]) = 0 := Finsupp.ext fun _ ↦ by
  simp [← monomial_one_one_eq_X]

theorem apply_eval_eq (x : A) (p : A[X]) :
    d (eval x p) = PolynomialModule.eval x (d.coeffwise p) + eval x (derivative p) • d x := by
  induction p using Polynomial.induction_on' with
  | h_add => simp_all only [eval_add, map_add, add_smul]; abel
  | h_monomial n a =>
    simp only [eval_monomial, leibniz, leibniz_pow, coeffwise_monomial,
      PolynomialModule.eval_single, derivative_monomial, ← mul_smul, nsmul_eq_smul_cast A]
    rw [add_comm]
    congr 2
    ring
```
This seems like a better approach. Note that you would need to relax the typeclass arguments on `PolynomialModule.map` to make this work.
By the way it would be nice if you can identify the missing lemmas and remove those `erw`s.
How could the typeclass parameters of `PolynomialModule.map` be relaxed? Its domain is `PolynomialModule R M`, which requires `CommRing R`. You'd have to relax all of `PolynomialModule`.
You're right. Then that's the thing to do if you really care about semirings.
I added the lemmas. I'm not sure about changing the definition - it makes `coeffwise_apply` definitional, and is a bit cleaner, but loses `R` being a semiring.
I don't think that matters much, unless you absolutely need semirings. Someone else who needs semirings may generalise `PolynomialModule` altogether.
